newsitem.title: USA: U.S. reserve assets fall in December.
newsitem.headline: U.S. reserve assets fall in December.

text.p: The Treasury Department said on Wednesday that U.S. reserve assets fell $354 million in December to $75.09 billion from $75.44 billion in November.
The department said U.S. holdings of foreign currencies were down to $38.29 billion in December from $38.49 billion in November.
Gold stock totaled $11.05 billion in both months.
Special Drawing Rights with the International Monetary Fund fell to $10.31 billion in December from $10.39 billion.
The value of the U.S. reserve position with the IMF fell to $15.44 billion in December from $15.52 billion in November.
